headline: Supreme Court justice Clarence Thomas' wife called GOP lawmakers 'pathetic' for not challenging the 2020 election results
author: Oma Seddiq
sentences: "House and Senate guys are pathetic too... only 4 GOP House members seen out in street rallies with grassroots... Gohmert, Jordan, Gosar, and Roy," Thomas texted Meadows, seemingly referencing GOP Reps. Louie Gohmert of Texas, Jim Jordan of Ohio, Paul Gosar of Arizona, and Chip Roy of Texas, per The Post.

In a November 10, 2020, text to then-White House chief of staff Mark Meadows, Thomas expressed frustration at the lack of Republicans uniting behind President Donald Trump and his claims that the 2020 election was stolen and rigged because of widespread voter fraud.

Virginia "Ginni" Thomas, a longtime conservative activist and wife to Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas, called Republican lawmakers who didn't challenge the 2020 election results "pathetic," The Washington Post reported Thursday.

The newly revealed texts come after Thomas recently acknowledged in an interview with the Washington Free Beacon that she attended the January 6, 2021 "Save America" rally at the Ellipse near the White House.
The text messages are among the thousands that the House select committee investigating the January 6 Capitol riot received from Meadows as part of its probe, CNN first reported on Thursday.
Each of the lawmakers later voted to object to the certification of the 2020 election results on January 6, 2021, except Roy, who criticized Trump in the wake of the Capitol riot.
